title: Sapphires and rubies are actually the same mineral...
content: Sapphires and rubies are actually the same mineral - corundum. The only difference is their color.

title: Emeralds are rarer than diamonds and are often mor...
content: Emeralds are rarer than diamonds and are often more valuable per carat.

title: Pearls are the only gemstones created by living cr...
content: Pearls are the only gemstones created by living creatures - mollusks like oysters and mussels.

title: Opals contain up to 20% water and can crack if the...
content: Opals contain up to 20% water and can crack if they dry out too quickly.

title: Amethyst was once considered as valuable as diamon...
content: Amethyst was once considered as valuable as diamonds until large deposits were found in Brazil.

title: Tanzanite is found only in one place on Earth - ne...
content: Tanzanite is found only in one place on Earth - near Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania.

title: Jade has been prized in China for over 7,000 years...
content: Jade has been prized in China for over 7,000 years and was more valuable than gold.

title: Garnets come in every color except blue, with gree...
content: Garnets come in every color except blue, with green being the rarest variety.

title: Turquoise was one of the first gems to be mined, w...
content: Turquoise was one of the first gems to be mined, with ancient mines dating back 6,000 years.

title: Moonstone displays a phenomenon called adularescen...
content: Moonstone displays a phenomenon called adularescence - a blue-white glow that moves across the surface.

title: Peridot is one of the few gems that occurs in only...
content: Peridot is one of the few gems that occurs in only one color - a distinctive olive green.

title: Aquamarine belongs to the beryl family and can gro...
content: Aquamarine belongs to the beryl family and can grow to enormous sizes, with some crystals weighing over 100 pounds.

title: Topaz is one of the hardest gemstones, rating 8 on...
content: Topaz is one of the hardest gemstones, rating 8 on the Mohs scale, making it excellent for jewelry.

title: Labradorite shows a play of colors called labrador...
content: Labradorite shows a play of colors called labradorescence, caused by light interference in its crystal structure.

title: Ammolite is an opalescent, iridescent gemstone for...
content: Ammolite is an opalescent, iridescent gemstone formed from the fossilized shells of ammonites — extinct marine mollusks that lived 70–75 million years ago.

title: Our Canadian Sapphire comes from the Blue Jay Mine...
content: Our Canadian Sapphire comes from the Blue Jay Mine near Revelstoke, British Columbia, and is currently the only active sapphire mine in Canada.

title: BC BlueJay sapphires are typically found embedded ...
content: BC BlueJay sapphires are typically found embedded within a feldspar- and biotite (mica)-rich host matrix. Many specimens even display Trapiche formations or star potential.
